properties.title: Java date and time API - Coptic calendar system
properties.author: Stephen Colebourne

section.name: Coptic calendar system
section.p: The Coptic calendar system implemented in Joda-time is as follows. Years are defined as per the Julian calendar system, that is once every four years. The year is broken down into 12 months, each of exactly 30 days in length. An extra period at the end of the year is either 5 or 6 days in length (depending on whether it is a leap year). Joda-time defines this period as a 13th month.

Year 1 in the Coptic calendar began on August 29, 284 CE (Julian), thus Coptic years do not begin at the same time as Julian years. The implementation is not proleptic, as it does not allow dates before the first Coptic year.

section.name: Using Coptic chronology in Joda-time
section.p: Within Joda-Time the Coptic calendar system can be used by obtaining an instance of CopticChronology. This is normally created using the factory method Chronology.getCoptic(). This is then passed into the constructors of the main date and time classes.
